citation.article-title: Silicibacter lacuscaerulensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a mesophilic moderately halophilic bacterium characteristic of the Blue Lagoon geothermal lake in Iceland.

p.s: Silicibacter (Si.li.ci.bac'ter L. masc. n. silex, silica; M.L. masc. n. bacter, rod-shaped bacterium, M.L. masc. n. Silicibacter rod-shaped bacterium living in silica (-rich) habitats)
Cells are Gram negative, unicellular, nonmotile, nonsporeforming, long rods, about 9-18μm in length and 0.6-0.8μm wide.
Obligately aerobic, mesophilic hetertrophs growing optimally at 45°C and at temperatures up to 50°C.
Do not hydrolyze starch or casein.
Growth on common amino acids such as arginine and lysine.
Cells are susceptible to chloramphenicol, penicillin, tetracycline, and polymyxin B, but resistant to streptomycin.
No utilization of tetramethylammoniumchloride but tolerance up to 0.2%.
The DNA composition is about 66% mol% GC.
